intro: Pearsonia grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved pearsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and leathery, providing a dense canopy, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Pearsonia grandifolia plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
